alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 5:37PM AKDT until May 15 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occuring. * WHERE...Yukon River at Eagle. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding is occuring, and large blocks of ice could be pushed onshore. Water will remain high and continue to rise until the ice jam releases. Water is over Mission Road at the old village site and rising. Flooding of other locations around Eagle is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM AKDT,The River Watch Team reports an ice jam on Yukon River near Eagle with two large sheets of ice jammed at Eagle Bluff. This is impounding water upstream of the ice jam and is causing rapid river rises upstream at Eagle. Water levels at Eagle have risen 8 ft since Thursday morning. - A large ice jam is causing major flooding at the mouth of the Fortymile River in the Yukon Territory. When the jam releases it will send an additional surge of water to push doownstream to Eagle. - http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River at Eagle stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
